title: No longer offered the option to use FILELINK
content:
A few months ago I posted a question "I'm no longer offered the option to use FILELINK". There was a solution offered by user Yu5tiqX9og. That post has apparently been archived, so I'm unable to see whether Yu5tiqX9og's solution/reply was ever posted. I managed to keep a copy of his solution, which he must have sent to me privately. 

  I italic text do remember that it did fix the problem I was having.   Here is the reply.

italic textThe following steps might be helpful: "Settings" > "Composition" > "Attachments" section > tick "Offer to share for files larger than __ MB. (Please see the attached image.)"

I don't have the exact image from the original post, but I've recreated what I believe it probably was. Please see attachment. I hope this helps, SweetTasha
creator: pwrichcreek

title: Cannot open JPEG images in default Windows image viewer anymore, PNG in the same viewer works
content:
I am an experienced TB user, but at the moment at a total loss for a solution to my problem.

I use Windows 11 Pro. When trying to click on image attachments for PNG and JPG/JPEG pictures, the behaviour is different: PNG images are displayed just fine in the Windows photo viewer, JPEG images are not. If I open the same images via double-click from the local disk, both open just fine in the same viewer. I have checked the file type settings already and even changed them to always ask me for JPEG images. I get asked just fine and see that TB wants to open the Windows photo viewer for both files types, but while it works for PNG, it does not for JPEG. There is no error message, just nothing happens, at least nothing visible to me.

When trying the same from a new user profile, it works as expected. I tried TB safe mode, deactivating all add-ons, but it still does not work in my main user profile.

I would be glad to receive hints for how to solve or at least debug this. Thanks in advance.
creator: kriegaex

title: Cannot edit calendar items after a few hours
content: Hi, I have a strange experience with thunderbird's calendar: an hour or two after i created a new appointment in my calendar, i cannot change this appointment anymore. When i do so, this appointment is not saved anymore when i click on "save & close". When i alter and save this appointment within the hour it works normally and the item is saved as expected. I searched the settings, but nothing could be found concerning this issue. My OS: Ubuntu 24.04.2 LTS. Thank you very much for your efforts. Wyl. Holland.
creator: firefoxaccount7

title: Windows Updates Break Thunderbird connection to Synology MailPlus Server accounts.
content:
I use Thunderbird Mail Client to access multiple Synology MailPlus accounts and accounts from Gmail and other services


Everytime ! Weekly! After Microsoft pushes another update I have to reconfigure Thunderbird to access Synology MailPlus accounts to receive mail. Mail on GMAIL, SPECTRUM and other mail services are not affected.

Microsoft is breaking something preventing only Thunderbird from retrieving mail from MailPlus Server.

I have to remove then add the accounts back in, Retrieving saved Profiles does not work to fix the problem.
creator: DavidFireFox

title: Thunderbird Calendar  Please re- add the Reminder Notification via email !
content: I've been using Thunderbird and its Calendar for MANY years very happily :-) My old main computer is a w7 Lap and the Thunderbird Calendar in that version has the option to set up a Reminder Notification via Email. And it still works with no problem! I just was given a used Laptop computer that I did a clean install of w11 on, and installed Thunderbird and setup the Thunderbird Calendar to my Google Calendar with NO problems! EXCEPT: I just created a New Event and a Reminder for it, and to my chagrin, there is NO option to be notified by Email anymore !!! grrrrrr  :-( Please, I beg the developers to reinstate that option ! I use that for every event that I create! eg I take MEDS and when I get the email reminder, I can delete the Email reminder to show myself that I've taken that med at that time !!!! Please advise ! THANK YOU
creator: MattMiller747
